markdown.markdown:
::: justify

I am a PhD Candidate in Statistics at Rice University. My research focuses on developing Bayesian models for multivariate data, working under the direction of Dr. [Marina Vannucci](https://marina.blogs.rice.edu/). I am passionate about formulating innovative statistical methods to analyze different types of data, with a diverse range of applications, from healthcare to sports.

When I am not immersed in data and research, I love soccer –watching or playing– as well as exploring new places and taking pictures. Check out some of my travel photos [here](https://mauroflorez.github.io/gallery.html).
:::

::: columns
## Research Interests

::: {.column width="30%"}
-   Bayesian Modeling
-   Statistical Computing
-   Graphical Models
-   Applied Statistics
-   Machine Learning
:::

::: {.column width="5%"}
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
::: justify
My latest projects involve developing frameworks for estimating graphical models that identify relationships or dependencies between different mixed data types.

A list of projects can be found [here](https://mauroflorez.github.io/projects.html).
:::
:::
:::

::: justify
## Education

![](media/logos2.png){fig-align="center" width="600"}

I completed my undergraduate studies in Bogotá, Colombia, earning a BS in *Mathematics* from Universidad Sergio Arboleda, with a tuition waiver scholarship. Additionally, I hold a BS in *Statistics* from the Universidad Nacional de Colombia, where I graduated with distinction (#1 class). In 2020, I was awarded a [Fulbright](https://www.fulbrightprogram.org/) scholarship to pursue my PhD at Rice University
:::

::: columns
## Selected Experience

-   **Data Scientist**, *Minciencias*, 2019 - 2020

-   **Data Analyst**, *Universidad del Rosario*, 2017 - 2018

-   **Lecturer** - See the full list of courses [here](https://mauroflorez.github.io/teaching.html).
:::

::: columns
::: {.column width="35%"}
## Software

-   R
-   Python (Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Pytorch)
-   SQL
-   Matlab
-   Tableau
-   Latex
-   Git
-   MS Office
:::

::: {.column width="5%"}
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
## Certifications

-   **Deep Learning**. (*DataCamp, 2024*) \[[Certificate](https://www.datacamp.com/completed/statement-of-accomplishment/track/fd6eb135af814741b062bb68c0d8eb1adbd4d76a)\]

-   **Developing LLM**. (*DataCamp, 2024*) \[[Certificate](https://www.datacamp.com/completed/statement-of-accomplishment/track/3e53de05e5673c349ecd9fb95b143a87891c7217)\]

-   **R Developer**. (*DataCamp, 2024*) \[[Certificate](https://www.datacamp.com/completed/statement-of-accomplishment/track/7add30a444c03f094691cc5c2e37aed02b5ee050)\]

-   **Applied Data Science with Python Specialization** - University of Michigan (*Coursera, 2019*) \[[Certificate](https://www.coursera.org/account/accomplishments/specialization/PWJ9L2Z83K5Z)\]
:::
:::
